article.title: Raytheon Receives Network Cooperative Radar Research Contract
article.text: Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems, Tewksbury, Massachusetts, is being awarded a $17,653,917 cost-plus-fixed-fee contract for science and technology research concerning the Network Cooperative Radar Program. The focus of this effort is to perform design and development for the Network Cooperative Radar Program. This contract contains an option, which if exercised, will bring the contract value to $18,749,375. Work will be performed in Tewksbury, Massachusetts, and is expected to be completed April 2017. If the option is exercised, work will continue through July 9, 2018. Fiscal 2015 research, development, test and evaluation (Navy) funds in the amount of $3,010,838 will be obligated at the time of award and will expire at end if current fiscal year. This contract was competitively procured under Office of Naval Research Broad Agency Announcement 15-001. Five full proposals were received for the solicitation. The Office of Naval Research, Arlington, Virginia, is the contracting activity (N00014-16-C-2007).
